pronuntiation british tongue p former changed b latines gentle pleasant sound sake himselfe thinketh learned expert men british tongue wrote ilands name b doe therein rather follow latines iudging bee liking romanes whereof short time grew heartburning hatred seuenty principall men conspired death many danger caesar death enemy battle abroad senatehouse amongst supposed friend peace treacherie may called peace cruelly murdered receiuing body three twenty wound whereof died sate emperour fiue moneths 12 ignorant british writer doe varie caesar relating proceeding british writer vary caesar speake honourably owne resistance himselfe hath set downe namely valour cassibelan king first attempt hee twice driuen backe without purpose cassibelan repulsed caesar twice forced take sea great hazard ship men yea losse owne sword great prowesse wonne single encounter nenion cassibelans brother surely howsoeuer polydore accounteth nenion caesar sword story new caesar carrieth himselfe gloriouslie owne affaire yet sundry renowned writer seemeth currant conquest went nothing smooth vntroubled beda hist li 1 c 2 little losse roman britaines liberty forgone easie resistance may collected euen couert passage caesar word appeareth hee durst sundry time giue britaines battle though harnessed leather souldiers old legionary long seruice called huge armour milites grauis armaturae hauing helmet corslet boot massy brasse iron large target strong twoedged sword great staffe clubbe headed iron pike oddes notwithstanding cassibelan vndermined mandubrace traiterously agricola whose courage could clouded dastardly feare held intent hearing prisoner taken manner enemy proceeding ordereth host accordingly diuiding armie three battle lay entrenched weakest whereof containing ninth legion britaines night assailed hauing slaine watch brake campe furious noise whose rescue agricola sent light horseman band foot whose ensignes armour glittering appearance day part misfortune onely imputed one contrariwise britaines presupposing valour skill generall vsing occasion carried away abated whit wonted courage armed youth transported child wiues place safety pursuit followed vntill night fulnesse britaines discomfited blood made end chase 13 roman side slaine wee must credit owne friend onely three hundred fortie person one extraordinary note roman losse thrice consul vnto common asia sendeth greeting doubt god themselues haue care wicked person shall bee brought light much doth appertaine vnto doth vnto punish refuse yeeld worship course take doth confirme persecute opinion impious men meere atheist whereby commeth passe desire quarrell god rather die yeeld wils embrace forme religion let seeme vnseasonable call remembrance earthquake lately happened yet great terrour griefe vnderstand like accident cast enuy common misfortune vpon shoulder whereby confidence trust god much increased whereas still ignorant true cause thing doe neglect answered bee molested vnlesse proued haue practised treason emperiall state touching matter haue giuen notice vnto haue answered like moderation father edict doe ordaine hereafter bee found thus busie molesting kinde men without offence command hee iulius capitol accused vpon point absolued albeit proued man charged antoninus person vertues bee christian accuser shall suffer punishment sought procure vpon edict promulged ephesus generall councell asia fauourable good emperour true professours indeed sort men hauing apothegme scipio africanus rife mouth rather saue one subiects life kill thousand enemy 6 stature tall seemely presence countenance maiesticall maners milde singular wit verie learned eloquent great louer husbandrie peaceable mercifull bounteous last vertues much exceeded priuate wealth publike wealth welfare state may bee aduanced fine large euloge praise fastened neither youth anie thing rashly age thing negligently honourable course hauing raigned twentie two yeares commended vnto aurelius betwixt whose nature condition much oddes betwixt day night one moderate louing industrious proud carelesse cruell fruit whereof poore christian felt whose chiefest pillers polycarpus bishop smyrna iustinus martyr excellent philosopher infinite put cruell death fourth persecution god saint begun whose licentious bloodie life lasting authoritie space nine yeares cut apoplexie presence aurelius beeing expidition towards germanie whose coine wee haue expressed wee finde minted face reuerse 3 aurelius emperour following warres reuolted inclosed enemy called quadi suffered great mortalitie pestilence much want water whereby himselfe host almost consumed time many christian souldiers campe commanded ionas call vpon god fell prostrate ground praiers obtained plenteous shower raine therewith fiue day extreamest drouth thirst whole army refreshed quadi contrariwise thunder aureli •… obtaineth •… ne christian praier eutropius euseb lib 5 cap 5 act monument prophetam regem dilexisti iustitiam odisti iniquitat •… prop •… vnxit 〈◊〉 deus deus tuus 〈◊〉 l •… titia pr •… consorti •… 〈◊〉 ī ꝓp̄ 〈◊〉 te deus deus tuus l p̄ cō cae et rursum iuxta prophetam regem deus iudicium tuum c non enim dixit iudicium ne que iustitiam caesaris filij enim regis gens christianae populi regni sunt qui sub vestra protectione pace regno degunt consistunt iuxta euangelium quemadmodum gallina congregat pullos sub ali gens verò regni britanniae populi vestri sunt quos diuisos debetis vnum ad concordiam pacem ad fidem legem christi ad sanctam ecclesiam congregare reuocare fouere manutenere protegere regere ab iniuriosis malitiosis ab inimicis semper defendere vae regno cuius rex puer est cuius principe manè comedunt non voco regem propter paruam nimiam aetatem 〈◊〉 propter paruam nimiam aetatem sed propter stultitiam iniquitatem insanitatem iuxta prophetam regem viri sanguinum dolosi non dimidiabunt dy suos c per comestionem intelligimus gulam per gulam luxuriam per luxuriam omnia turpia peruersa mala iuxta salomonem regem maleuolam animam non introibit sapientia nec habitabit corpore subdito peccatis rex dicitur à regendo non à regno rex eris dum bene regis quod nisi feceris nomen regis non te constabit nomen regis perdes quod absit det vobis omnipotens deus regnum britanniae sic regere vt possitis cum eo regnare aeternum cuius vicarius est regno forced redeeme peace mony much weakned losse men sent rome present supply relation great danger enemy 〈◊〉 brought britaine strength newes touched seuerus quick notwithstanding yeeres sixty least gout brother geta accompanied father britaine aemilius papinianus famous lawyer 5 britaines hearing emperor approch sent embassage intreaty peace whereby iland might haue setled secured without blood old man saith sabellicus vnsatiable desire beare glorious sirname britannicus preferred warre accepted proffered subiection 6 seuerus thus entred geta appointed remaine south prouince gouerne part stood quiet assisted aemilius papinianus famous lawyer whose tribunall seat held yorke himselfe bassianus marching fifty thousand seuerus army dead toylesome labor sicknesse north maatae caledonians neighbour bare themselues boldly vpon aduantage country water brackish vnholsome drinke enemy aire sharpe contagious constitution soile selfe pestred lough bog meares mountaines roman forced make way continuall labour cutting downe wood building bridge drayning meares distemperature diet continuall sabellicus labour contagiousnesse aire affliction sicknesse fifty thousand perished without battaile saith dio many souldiers also herodian whose spirit spent feeblenesse could keepe ranke march meere caledoniane desire peace pitty slaine fellowes lest fall hand enemy 7 misery notwithstanding old seuerus indured fought many battailes sabellicus confesseth euer difficulty roman britaines yet small skirmish went away victor continued course resolution lastly caledonians thought good intreate peace vpon condition granted first forthwith lay aside hostile armes without resistance next deliuer roman possession country next abutting prouince lastly thenceforth liue quiet attempting nothing publike peace 8 state thus setled seuerus bethought himselfe meanes secure prouince building many inland strength anew repairing stone cement formerly turffe earth appeareth inscription found ruines despaire griefe disdaine enemy successe girdle wore strangled himselfe death hee gardianus father strangled beene stiled emperour twenty six day whereat maximinus little ioifull senate lesse perplexed seeing themselues depriued hope laid open tyrant like lion came raging threatning reuenge blouds 6 state thus standing peeres prince thereof assembled themselues together rome temple iupiter long debating present danger concluded maximus pupienus clodius balbinus together bee emperours men great account fauour people taking oath imperiall robe leuied force maintaine cause balbinus taking charge citie pupienus marched meet maximinus great pride passed alpes entred italie laid siege aquieliea memorable citizen wiues cut haire head make bowstring resistance hatefull tyrant long assault preuailing little discontented souldiers fell mutinie entring pauilion noone day without resistance slew sonne bearing name hee created caesar maximinus sonne slaine whose monies minted haue inserted balbinus thus elected together emperor 238 one action resident great sedition chanced betwixt senate souldiers grew bloudie issue among citizen rome selfe set fire sundrie place emperours presence themselues bee taxed aspersion rather german stranger brought guard themselues bee trusted turning spleene present emperours sought set vp new shortly found opportunitie effect 4 emperours though aged certaine three hundred twentie thousand men warre entred confines whose waight doth seeme burden earth selfe whose warrelike preparation make part empire tremble quake strike battle wherein conquest mine ioy fall yet pray remember fight galienus hath raigned rent strength roman remote prouinces rebellion lollianus posthumus eugenius regillianus celsus others haue weakened sinewes armes broken sword launce defense may well say wee want strength yet weapon wherewithall fight shame spoken zenobia woman command crossebowes bend vnarmed brest small soeuer therefore performance shall bee seruice men two thousand shippes laden munition whole house filled toppes target shield sword launce abiliments warre whereof wrote againe rome following enemie successe victorie thracia neere bizantium macedonia neere thessalonica droue gothes part long infested restored wonted bound empire thence marching germanie neere lake called garda gaue reuolted nation great ouerthrow eutropius victor doe report hee vanquished two thousand strong german established againe subiection roman power minding goe forward tetricus puissant zenobia feuer first cut purpose shortlie life thing strange rare flauius claudius died naturall death age course raignes wee haue hitherto seene great monarch die earthly mould meanest men day roman emperour die bed men doe naturall death 7 hee personage tall bodie constantius set forward encounter comming tharsus antioch syria fell sicke feuer still increased trauelled border cilicia place called mopsus wels situated amianus mar lib 21 cap 13 foote mounttaurus died third day nouember yeere christ ieromes account three hundred sixtie foure others three hundred sixtie one hee ruled twenty foure yeeres liued fortie moneths amianus marcellinus pomp laetus affirme socrates zosimus time raigning say liued forty fiue yeeres raigned thirtie eight thirteen caesar life father seuen competitor liues brother seuenteene yeeres emperor alone hee neither accounted best worst emperor vertues seeming hold scoale amianus lib 26 cap 9 vice temperate courteous liberall affable elequent yet desirous speake well blunt witted yet constantius perfection defect •… bononia lieth diuided opposite tract land narrow channell ebbing flowing terrible tide water seene sometimes match highest mountaine againe settle ieuell plaines without harme sailers passage sleue gentle course hee crossed arriued ribchester rutupie quiet roade harbour ouer whence bactauians heruli iouij victores company bold confident strength come marched towards lundinium ancient citie posterity afterwards named augusta london called augusta hauing seuered troopes sundry part charged vpon company rouing robbing enemy euen heauie laden booty spoiles driuing away men woman bound captiues besides much cattle great prey hee soone discomfited restored poore distressed tributary liberty loss bestowing small parcel thereof among weary welldeseruing souldiers entred city exceeding theodosius ioifullie receiued london great ioy manner pettytriumph erewhile ouerwhelmed calamity sudden refreshed set perfect safety 5 vpon prosperous successe encouraged greater attempt hee abode yet doubtfull future casting himselfe many proiects poised fortune scale alike lastly certaine captiues fugitiues hee learned company sundry fierce nation spread farre diffusedly vpon face prouince could vanquished vnlesse sleight stratagemes edict therefore first proclaimed impunitie forsaken colour would returne wherby many run enemie owne pleasure beene dispersed diuers part came countenance declared resolution behalfe notwithstanding mistrusting euent pensiue still care hee thought good call assistance ciuilis man great vnderstanding quicke spirit withall vpright iusticer rule britaine deputie likewise dulcitius captaine renowned skill deedes armes 6 consultation hauing gotten amianus marcel lib 28 cap 7 courage departing augusta power souldiers politike industrie leuied trained fire inuade roman territory restored wholly vnto former state city castle sustained many loss established sure peace long time following 7 happened while atchieued exploit dangerous matter likely haue broken great mischiefe beene quenched beginning enterprise one valentinus valeria pannonia man proud spirit first deputy leiutenant president notable offense banished britaine frontinus immediately beene one impatient rest like noisome wilde beast vpon certaine swelling pride rose vp commotion theodosius hee perceiued man able withstand wicked designes howbeit casting many way closely apparantly gale vnmeasurable desire rose higher solicited well banished person souldiers promising time would affoord reward allure draw actuall attempt yet day came wherein haue beene effected theodosius hauing intelligence thereof surprized valentinus inward complices deliuered vnto dulcitius put death valentinus rebell put death accordingly militarie skill policie wherein hee reputed haue exceeded men liuing day gessing future danger hee theodosius expert warriour inhibited inquisition made touching rest conspirator lest generall feare surprising spread abroad among many tempestuous trouble prouinces well allaied reuiue againe 8 therefore turning himselfe businesse reforming enormity consequence danger quite ouerblowne reedified city repaired garison castle fortified frontier standing watch strong forefenses thus hauing recouered prouince againe yeelded subiection enemy reduced vnto pristine estate meanes motion againe lawfull gouernour appointed also named valentia honour valentinianus emperor britaine called valentia 9 areans kinde men witnesseth amianus instituted ancient time politicke amian marcel lib 28 cap 7 imploiments little little fallen disorder vice remooued areans remoued station siations manifestly conuicted induced greatnesse reward receiued promised diuers time discouered vnto barbarous whatsoeuer done debated betwixt president counsell indeed charge runne fro long iournies intimate make knowne vnto roman captaines vpon march doings stirres among neighbournations whereby great opportunity know reueale secret state 10 thus theodosius hauing managed excellently affaire sent emperours court leauing prouince ouerioied peace lesse famous many important victory either furius camillus papinius theodosius comparable camillus cursor honourably accompanied attended vnto narrow sea heartie loue fauour men departed gentle gale winde passed ouer came prince campe receiued ioy praise succeeded roome valens iouinus conduct horseman martiall deed happily atchieued honour statue erected resembling man armes horsebacke symmachus may vnderstood thus speaking sonne theodosius author symmachus kindred stocke captaine generall africke britaine among ancient title consecrated honourable order statue knighthood commendation claudian full note thus poetically sang ille caledonijs posuit qui castra pruinis qui medios libyae sub casside pertulit aestus claudian praise theodosius terribilis mauro debellator que britanni littoris ac pariter boreae vastator austri quid rigor aeternus coeli quid sydera prosunt ignotum que fretum maduerunt saxone forcd south north yeeld auaild cold clime strange sea starres orkney iles drencht saxon gore thule reake picts bloud spilt warres ireland huge heapes scot deplore 11 strange dreadfull signes third yeere emperour chanced earthquake dreadfull sight fearefull earthquake amian marcell lib 26 cap 14 inundation like whereof marcellinus thus reporteth little sunnerising saith waighty steddy masse whole earthly globe shooke flash lightning thicke fierce going sea also driuen aside waues billowes preposterously tumbling retiring back deepe gulfes discouered laid empty man might haue seene sundry sort swimming creature sticking gulfes sea laid bare many city drowned mudde also vast vallies rockes nature set farre away vnder huge water behold beames sunne insomuch many ship bedded fast drie ground flockes people stragled pleasure small remaines water take vp fish seaspoile sudden waues disdaining thus dispossessed returned violent beating vpon ilands promontory lay farre sea ouerslowed threatning waste italy burgundians threaten italie gallio recalled britaines quite forsaken roman aetius compelled recall gallio legion secure countrey paris whilest himselfe followed dangerous enemie 7 ready depart france told britain roman take long painefull iournies neither time especially empire danger ouerrun therefore willed thenceforth stand vpon guard prouide owne safety end regard good seruices done roman taught vse armour roman kindnesse departing britaine beda hist angl lib 1 cap 12 weapon also strengthen fortification wall turfe began build firme stone laid eight foot thicknesse became ninth king 9 677 kenwin began raigne westsaxons raigned space nine yeeres hee great scourge vnto weake ouerborne britaines making conquest possession forcing euen seashoare great scourge ouerborn britaine people allotted vnto miserie stranger pursued vehemently lastly driuen westangle iland liues defended maintained among waste mountaines hard rockes therein propitious gentle stonie heart oppressor ceadwalla valiant young man bloudroyall genisses saith beda banished 10 686 beda hist eccles angl lib 4 ca 15 country enuie others maligned vertues worthinesse succeeded kenwin kinsman kingdome westsaxons greater glory raigned prouince done ceadwall raigned greater glorie sonne kenbert whose father ched second sonne cuth cuth third sonne kenrik eldest sonne cherdik laid first stone kingdomes foundation first brunt furie edilwach king descent southsaxons field slew another battell berthun made himselfe king warres southsaxons state ile wight also almost quite wasted though vnbaptized yet hee binde himselfe vow giue fourth part spoile vnto god vse performed accordingly vnto bishop vow god wilfrid bernewine hildila conuerted people idolatrous superstition vnto last saxon conuerted christ true seruice christ beeing last part saxon possession turned pagan manner specious deuotion malmesburie giueth censure although wee praise affestion saith hee yet allow wee example written offereth vnto god good vnpleasing •… fice god poore dooth sacrifice sonne sight father kent also greeuous warres hee twice afflicted therein spilt much christian blood great bloudthen kent nature selfe therein offended hee last much lamented repentance whereof hee repentance raigned great stoutnes space two yeeres zealous deuotion went rome pope sergius baptized vpon easter euen saith beda baptizing yeere redemption 689 name peter wearing yet white robe innocencie put rite vpon lauer baptisme fell sicke twentieth day death april following died hauing neither wife childe read buried edwine •… rrer deathsman resolutely answered nothing concerned either aske know estate oh edwine said thinke know thy man sheweth griefe vntold sorrow cause thy sitting thus vpon stone thy death pretended euen hand wouldest thou giue rid thee danger make king redwald thy assured preseruer thing quoth edwine power shall reward said shall set demandeth would giue eased thee vpon throne thy kingdome glory none thy progenitor euer attained vnto would bee thankfull man said edwine thing time reason required edwine answer right ought tell edwine said man shew thee safe way promiseth shew saue soule preserue life thy soule either thou present knowest thy parent euer heard wilt thou consent imbrace counsell yea said edwine god forbid bee ruled thus free present danger set vpon throne kingdome great fauours also teach mee way eternall life vpon answere laying right hand edwines head said vnto thing shall order come passe call minde time thou hast promised vanished hee suddenly vanisheth away presence young prince thus left betwixt hope despaire friend forewarned death came hastily edwines friend bringeth good newes cheerfull countenance come edwine quoth surcease thy care doe bedewe church commonwealth famous vniuersities england aboue europe art building reuenewes like found europe saith peter martyr truely returne sigebert wearied waighty affair world laid burden intreaty allurement contrary lastly released licence depart court vnto abbey coldinghā first vailed nunne vnder abbesse ehba thence departing liued ely became selfe abbesse thereof wherein lastly owne kingdome westsaxia couenants promised swore yet contrary tooke deuonshire wintred excester vnto supply sea sought ioine themselues met boisterous blast one hundred twenty ship cast away tempest swanwicke vpon coast landarmy marching towards excester welcommed sharpe encounter king elfred gaue pledge oath depart speed 6 fortune euer dallying shee meanes downcast set chance losse presently vpon saxon side three king gurthrun esketel ammond thought good let elfred thus rest thereupon drew force westward towards chipingham three king elfred mannor wintred compelled th westsaxons either yeeld forsake country 7 king elfred therefore strength hasted towards seuenteene mile 876 bristow pitched downe tent euen face enemy betwixt fierce nation great battaile fought infinite losse bloud side vpon equall departure neither could challenge bee master field yet report went king elfred discomfited turned greatly aduantage thereupon many english hasted succour lest ouerthrow bane strengthes thus renued vnexpected supply time detracted stay danish rage returned heart land abington oxford pitched standreds fight abington 8 thither english repaired next morning ordered army neither enemy vnprepared braues stood ready receiue encounter battaile ioyned continued losse bloud accounted one sorest euer betwixt beene fought onely parted approch night neither party challenging honor day losse great vpon side seuen battailes reported fought yeare whereby strengthes much abated spilt bloud cooled seuen battailes one yeare liuers lastly concluded vpon peace one article dane admit nation arriue iland soone broken sequel shew 9 yeare eight hundred seuenty sixe saith simon dunelmensis rollo nobleman denmarke great army entred england 876 simon dunel lesse spoile destruction present ruine thy last wracke conceale thy great beauty king edgar eye giue entertainement meanest attire let pray thee time bee nightly curtaines drawne newnuptiall bed dayly cloudes hide thy splendent sunne sharpe piercing sight whose vigour ray soone set waxen wing fire ready melt farre softer heat pitch thou seest defileth hand forbid giue occasion euill vaile thy fairenesse scarfes thamar herod 2 sam 13 〈◊〉 virgil aened amnon thamar mirami aeneas dido yea seeke example farre king edgar variation vnsted fast motion doth easily bewray selfe could either holy wolfhild beautifull ethelfled wanton wench andeuer keepe needle compasse certaine one point nothing lesse still led loadstone euer mutable turning affection thou wilt say hee religious founding monastery hath expiated sinnes indeed many built time posterity must thanke holy dunstan whose deuotion good deed haue sprung thy person holier sacred wolfhilds thy birth beauty greater ethelfled white daughter also duke wolfhilds ethelfled former holy votary hee made sinke pollution later branded age hatefull name concubine sonne among v esteemed bastard bee motiues beauteous vertuous lady sell honour low toolate repented price neither think sweet countesse thy husband iealous suspect thy constancy know great thy selfe wholy complete honourable vertues yet consider pray thee thou art young maist easily caught especially old master game neither perswade thy selfe strength able hold great assault men mighty king much know thou art wise enough hath said onely let mee adde euill beginning haue neuer good end kind kisse hoping hee wonne wife prepared first welcome king edgar lady elfrida thus left selfe began seriously thinke vpon curtaine sermon whose text distasted taken ouerworne threedbare cloth prouerbe though fortune wholly residing altogether consisting parentage apparell nothing part self •… hath beauty thought courted elfridaalone king famoused report compared helen must hid must falsifie bely nature bounty mine owne value men report saue credit hath impaired mine belied worth must need defoule selfe faire foule hath kept state seat queene know name countesse great wife earle honourable yet birth endowment haue assigned beauty far lesse warnes end owne beginning trechery tels example others obserues none himselfe ielous forsooth yet must looke faire others pitch fire wine bush holy wolfhild white ethelfled yet must made far worse would men knew heate cheeke wherein beauty blazed would lesse suspect suffer face vnmaskt take aire eies wee whit condemnable shewing cannot hid neither shall come thus resoluing bee right woman desired nothing thing forbidden made preparation put practise body shee endulced sweetest balmes displaied haire bespangled pearles bestrewed breast elfrid •… disloialtie bosome ruby diamond rich iewels glittering like starres depended necke ornament euery way sutable thus rather angell ladylike shee attended approach entrance king faire obeisance seemely grace receiued edgar greedie eye presently collecting ray shining beauty became burning glasse heart sparkle faire falling traine loue set sens fire yet dissembling passion passed treason domesticke falshood nauy betraied dane hand battaile weakened reuolt captaines designes bewraied owne counsellor also inforcing composition dishonourable peace selfe disesteemeed scorne neither regard god man contrary equity lawes warre nation farre hope better successe haue cause feare losse kingdom extinct english nation renowne therefore seeing enemy hand hand throat let v foresight counsell saue paine taking safetie owne liues else courage sheath sword bowel either willing enter secure estate nation irrecouerable ruine 31 lamentable oration deliuered passion iustlypensiue king touched hearer heartes asmuch distracted afflicted mind abide battaile saw bootlesse treason leader many time defeating victory yeeld themselues enemy would beginne seruitude misery flee eternall ignominy reproch thus opinion canuased nothing put practise whereas meane while dane went forward victory got part land yea london also submission wherewith vnfortunate ethelred deiected death died title dane immediately aduanced canutus sonne king 33 english liked nothing lesse bondage especially vnder tyrannizing intruder 1015 thought neuer time shake yoake therefore great ioy hast sent normandy natiue king ethelred vnreadie recouering right foreslowed meanes either hasten strengthen enterprize hauing assistance brother normandy lent following landed england vnto resorted people part accounting greatest ioy see face king 34 canutus gainsborough souldierlike mustered managed men holding good canutus winneth loue english policie keepe bounty father got tyranny made spare chased 〈◊〉 canute able resist puissant army held sea safe land entring humber sailed sandwich sore grieued misery confederate requited king ethelred friend like commaunded pledge beene matth west deliuered noble vnto father wil mal •… haue nose slit hand cut cruelty acted hee sailed denmarke hopelesse good issue england 35 turkil dane retained said king ethelred pay seeing successe sodainely altered sore repented reuolt turkil inciteth ca •… england dane knowing time recouer reputation nine shippes sailed denmarke instantly importuning canut addresse againe england alleadging feares weaknesse people beauty fertility land eden respect owne barren seat moue himselfe would assist english least thought like hee spurred himselfe forward full curriere canutus therefore aide brother harrold rigged forth nauie two hundred saile furnished souldiers abiliments warre whose terror landed england canutus nauie power report made greater encrease terrour fearefull enemy sea springtide 13 beginning againe increase power despoile al country battaile edmund canute brought feare inhabitant himselfe submission many english king edmund therefore made preparation thitherward ashdone three mile saffronwalden gaue battaile canute wherein bloudy slaughter ensued though equall chance foile victory vntill lastly dane beganne giue backe euertraiterous edrik perceiued went strength vnto side maintained battaile otherwise point lost whereby dane regained day betraied english ouerthrow died edmunds nobility duke alfred duke goodwin duke athelward duke athelwin earle vrchell wil malmsb simon name stept forth reported betwixt two army vttered effect speech 15 many battailes haue beene fought much bloud already spilt soueraignitie aduice captaine single combat land betwixt two fierce nation valour general captaines souldiers sufficiently tried wherein euen fortune selfe seemeth haue beene conquered one battaile wonne long kept neither loser weakened hee courage power winne next marke aime honour fame title indeed accompany war neither long enioyed much attained vnto common souldiers whose valour bloud part wonne let therefore would weare diademe beare hazard himselfe without confusion many men either trie fortune single combat shall commaund obey diuide betwixt kingdome may suffice two hath maintained seuen 16 affirme speech duke edriks hardly belieue good motion matth west proceede bad man euer vttered acceptably receiued edmund canut thereupon sight army entred small iland embraced armes seuern called alney adioyning vnto city gloucester prince complete armour length canute hauing receiued dangerous wound seeing himselfe ouermatched strength wished mat westminster comprimise thus spake edmund loud voice necessity thus moue v valiant prince obtaining title afterward ouerranne kingdome though present inhabitant enraged losse chiefe addressing great number reuenge forced lose liues sword rest saue flight ship 2 notwithstanding former preparation contented deferre returne till 800 dayes king eghert whose raigne elsewhere see seuenth booke chap 31 haue touched disquieted three seuerall inuasions first north second wale last kent king though many loss hazard owne person yet great resolution persisted till hee disburdened land dangerous guest fleshflies hauing tasted sweet though often beaten would long bee kept away 〈◊〉 l 5 c 1 could easily take vpon ensuing occasion 3 osbright northumbrian viceroy deputed westsaxons chance hee followed disport hunting came house noble man named beornbocador whose lady passing feature absence gaue honourable entertainement intreated himselfe traine repose themselues wearisome delight viceroy already ensnared beauty accepted courteous offer much tast meates surfeite eye rare beauty lasciuiously dote owne affection dinner ended ready depart though weighty matter handled commaunded auoidance presence taking lady withdrawing chamber vnder pretence secret conference greatly tending aduancement lord selfe vnnobly able preuaile smooth perswasions force violate constant chastity dishonour thus receiued minde distracted like thamars husband returne 2 sam 13 1 •… ashamed behold face whose bed beene wronged flouds teares shee thus set open sluces passion 4 thy fortune accorded thine owne desert thy choice proceeded vow obliged staine blemish touched thine honour cause suspition approched thy thought selfe beene selfe blushing cheekes inuited thy sharpe piercing eye looke guilty defiled breast thou maist see disfurnished honour closet pure chastity broken vp onely heart soule cleane yet feares taineture polluted caske would haue passage thy reuenging hand loathsome prison filthy truncke must confesse sexe weake accompanied many fault yet none excusable small soeuer much lesse greatest shame doth follow inward guilt continually attendeth created inuiolable firme allurement enforcement whose constancy flexible weakenes guarded true honour iust armes bee protected beorn beorn husband dare call thee reuenge therefore wrong made thy shame scandale sexe vpon monster nay diuell osbright name corcorrupts breath want word deplore griefe hath law lust measure action power priuiledge loathsome life greatnesse while selfefeare seruile flatterie maske basenesse crouching obedience beare wrong vile adultery thou yet art free deiected degenerate thought hast thou smoothed wicked euerworking vice stil thy self truly noble thou art may place thou owe •… respect therewith losse honour thine affection thy bed thy loue thy beloued yet hast thou lost thy bereauer thou wast stay whilest stayed thee beeing downe reuenge fall instinct nature doth pitty weakenesse law nation doth maintaine honour sword knighthood sworne vnsheathed iust defence much linke wedlocke claimes hath lockt two heart one ala ward broken thy shame might haue beene thine honour reuenge thy selfe therefore mee else shall hand let ghost shall still attend thee acclamation till thou reuenge stained bloud 5 beorn vnwonted thus bee welcommed much amazed wiues malady gentle word drew particular inward griefe reuealed well shame teares sob would suffer manner deed stil vrging reuenge wrong beorn touched thus quicke pacifie distressed wife little dissemble wrath excusing fact power prince might command owne weak nesse vnable resist strength man commended much loue constancy alleadging wrong bee equall greater regard sexe willed set string tune till sitte opportunity would serue strike shee distasting sweet consort wrested passiō high strain nothing couldbe heard reuenge bloud 6 beorn thus instigated continuall cry wife whose rape already selfe giuen sufficient cause wrath first consulting neerest friend offered assistance wicked libidinous prince repairing court presence made knowne vnsufferable wrong vtter defiance departed threatning death nobleman youth brought vp denmarke reported haue allied danish roiall bloud hee therefore accounted nation surest vnto himselfe fittest proue aduantageous ambition therfore bethought crowne might bee worne 7 therefore separate heart subiects prince bee goodwins diuelish policy greater wound vnto hee caused king impose heauy tribute vpon english onely pay dane fleete appointing euerie henry hunt wil malmsbury mat westminster simon dun common souldier mariner receiue eight markes money euery officer master twelue amounted summe histor claime second young edgar vnto hee great vncle last vnto harold himselfe saith edmerus also marianus liued time writeth ed •… maria •… polyer 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ca 2 •… harold thereupon sacred crowned aldredus archbishop yorke hereby hee freed imputation intrusion wrong 14 state thus standing subiects contentment day •… increasing presently somwhat perplexed ambassage sent norman putting mind couenant oath aswell custody crowne behoofe solemnazion mariage contracted betwixt daughter 15 harold thought himselfe surely seated heart subiects therefore also sure kingdome answered ambassador subiects loue soueraignes strength held master demaund vniust oath extorted time extremity cannot bind maker conscience performe ioyne one sinne another oath taken feare death imprisonment duke himselfe well knew admit voluntarily without feare could said subiect without allowance king whole state giue away crownes succession preiudice surely kingdome better account bee determined priuate onely betwixt two kind answeres sent messenger away 16 norman till thought england sure deuoted hope duke king stormed see himselfe thus frustrated sudden stead crown haue scornes heaped head therefore nothing contented sleight answere returned ambassador againe vnto harold hee laid claime large king edward court france faithfully promised succession vnto againe afterwards ratified rand higden polyc lib 6 cap 29 england done without consent state confirmed stigandus archbishoppe canterbury earles goodwin syward yea harold himselfe firmely assured brother nephew deliuered pledge end election title inheritance promise validity could hee giue whereof interessed dane time euer like tell duke said kingdome brought setled estate loue liking english neuer admit stranger rule ouer touching contract yonger daughter hee well seeth god hath taken away occasion alienating crowne surely law hath likewise prouided remedy rash v •… w whose precept mean follow therefore said duke weigh abiured land thenceforth attempt hostilitie english peace twenty small vessel cary away slaine hurt suffered depart simon dun bringing heauy newes denmarke losse king ouerthrow army mat westm 24 answered former warre french empouerished much wealth new war raised therein substance spent gain part would thereby wasted hardly would sufficient defēd thought safety hold hazard inuade territory others war intēded iust though yet seemed necessary exceeding dāgerous besides said norman allegiance bound military seruices forrein part therefore paiments could bee assessed vpon although william fitzosberne man high fauour duke gratious among people endeauoured meanes effect yea draw others example proffered set forty tall ship vpon owne charge towards warre yet would bee therefore duke prouince mercians gouerned prouinciall deputy northumbrians king scot picts also iland kept limit vnder like gouernment amongst northumbrians dane cheefest abiding prouince rollo dane brought first men land making warre vpon nation built castle fortress fortifie himselfe nauy lying vpon sea proceeding forward continent tooke great booty men cattle spoiles lading ship lay anchor inhabitant country making head still worst 7 rollo yet doubtful suspence doe desired indeed returne country king indignation obstacle way next hee affected try fortune france yet feared issue would dangerous people exasperated harm done chiefely diademe england ran minde though hee knew hazard great match small force host king perplexed thought chanced saith author fall sweet slumber sleepe hee seemed sit kingdome france vpon high hil rollo dream bending headforward riuer issued top mountaine foote whereof beneath hee alb crantius saw many kindes bird washed ruddy left wing water fed together flew built nest time appointed brought forth yong 8 rollo awaking pleasing dream imparted vnto consort desiring iudgements interpretation way satisfying hee called christian english captiues man england thought follow fortune best leader departed fair rollo sendeth sound king alstan land intended sound king ambassage might find inclinable league might haue refuge future chaunces resolute go country sought banishment habitation restin going forth many followed v incouraged v seeke winne land conquest supplying v strength giuing v great hope victory thing wee resolued take hand tempest weather draue v king english port staying fit season put againe forth winter withheld v want made v seeke land whereupon men euermore brought vp warre beeing euill intreated inhabitant moued iniuries prouide owne defence wherein small skirmish haue passed betwixt prince therefore generall rollo doth humbly require peace thee permitted soiourne thy land time relieue company thing necessary wee paying sufficiently thing thou shalt grant hee shall rest content pacified vntill next spring time meanes take intended voyage 11 alstenus ignorant danish cruelty great army might oppresse english though euent soone shewed hee little ment doe hee pretended 24 peace thus established among conference beseeming estate chaunced king william demand reason came passe fortune bee one day battaile subdue english dane could doe many question whilst lib alban vita fretheric stood looking others expecting answere stout abbot fretherick stept forth said 25 reason thereof may easily bee giuen occasion bee well weighed wontedly land defended dint sword vntill warlike wearer good speech ill taken vpon godly deuotions laid side vpon altar orison ouerlong rest growne rustie edge dull field said hee maintenance martiall men great part land reuenewes daily conuerted pious imploiments maintaine defend holy votary whose praiers pierce deeper sword therefore thou art obliged ô king maintaine peace haue beene cause thy easie purchase 26 william word well mouth replied said clergy rich strengthned land thereby 〈◊〉 weakened men armes keepe onely religious safet •… shall laitie lie exposed 〈◊〉 dane king williams angry answere forreine enemy surely owne mouthes iudge redresse first begin lib alban thee whereupon hee tooke abbey saint albanes land reuenewes lay betwixt barnet londonstone abbot fretherick whose ouerbold answer offended king without delay called chapter brother shewing approaching danger auoid present storme went himselfe ely hee desisted wonted machination conquerour 26 conference ended king oath receiued english army disband themselues dreaming good fortune foot hoping greatest stormes danger past presently proued vaine surmise king william hauing compounded simon dun math paris dane lay last winter northumberland paid great summe departure beganne extreamely hate rebel full resolution destruction suddainely king william worketh vpon aduantage set vpon apart durst attempt vnited slaying many imprisoning others prosecuting fire sword wel could first gone 27 edgar etheling got scotland edwin earle yorkeshire following like intent slaine way owne souldiers ran higden henry hunt math paris egelwin bishop durham morcar earle chester siward surnamed bran hereward verie valiant knight got ile ely relying wholly ile ely fortified william aduantage place hereward receiued hallowed sword benediction vnckle abbot peterborow valiantly defended owne inheritance norman lesse ingulphus couragewithstood conquerour made captaine assembled 28 king lest delay giue aduantage harbor vnbrideled subiects great power hasted thitherward stopping vp east passage flight reliefe king william assaulteth ile ely drew causy west deepe fennes euen two mile length likewise built castle wisbech roger wind ile raised another timber turffes called according name captaine hereward place many assaultes bickering made yet entrance gotten morcar boat escaped ile scotland obtained price distressed could praier malcolme king rescue reuenge inuaded cumberland forraged theisdale hereward also went ile got scot inuade cumberland gallant crew choise youthfull souldiers stood stoutly defence liberty 29 meane monkes oppressed misery sued mercy vnto king thurstan abbot repairing warwick william lay offered entrance vnto ile hee abbot would hold howsoeuer rest fared would restore abbey ancient possession king reioicing obtaine wit canutus could maine strength accorded request great hast little difficulty got ile slaying thousand common sort hec vsed great cruelty better imprisoning many dismembring others hand eies feete egelwine bishop durham hee imprisoned first abington vvestminster whose diet either sparing stomack great forbearance reported ere long died hunger 30 howsoeuer monkes ely kept promise william betraying ile contrariwise brake preseruation peace iohn stow mean praiers would enter eares •… l sound seuen hundred markes opened way disposition rufus appeared time sitting dinner purposing forthwith take pleasure hunting messenger brought sudden newes siege mayne city normandy whereto mayne normaney besieged henry hunt king answered would take aduice doe thy subiects replied party distresse cannot delaied whereat king swore king readinesse releeue wonted oath could would turne backe till thereupon commanded breake downe wall might goe forth next way sea leauing straight commission noble wil malms follow celerity 32 wind contrary thereby sea king great rage pilote misdoubting hazard shipwrake desired humbly expect till boisterous element calmer passage safe wherunto answered whit daunted hast thou euer heard yes king pharao drowned pilot durst haue replied wil genetic king hath beene drowned therefore hoise vp sailes charge thee gone city vpon vnexpected speed king soone released helias consull cinomannia beleaguer taken traine king william iested face man neither martiall prowesse policie indignity noble helias disdainingly storming great boldnesse said vnto courage helias prisoner rufus thy prisoner thy prowesse chance warre owne misfortune liberty thou shouldest well know man thus laughed king wellliking confidence spirit well said hee king william releateth giue thee full liberty goe thy way doe thee lieth man euer mate thee 33 surely howsoeuer might blemished great valour many staines bad stephen desire liberty crowne let enioy thereunto offered pledge many great person protested empresse hee thenceforth would deuote himselfe vnto god either become monke pilgrime henry winchester also likewise hauing receiued city lady thought doe new prince might haue would aske became importunate suppliant ouer hard lawes imposed father might remitted king empresse facile grant suite edward might wholy bee force shee reiected petitioner pride say may seeme rather policy holding safest passeaffaires importance vpon intreaty due aduice gouerne subiect seuere austerenes rather indulgent lenitie monke nuborough speake declared king presence clergy mē cōmitted aboue hundred murthers vnder raign gul nubrig l 2 c 16 wherewith king highly offended hee punishing somewhat vehement blame king much earnestnes must lie prelate much gaue cause thereof whereas sacred canon ordaine clerk found guilty onely hainous grieuous sinnes also lesser bee degraded thousand church england like innumerable chaffe amongst little good corne yet many yeeres haue beene depriued prelate sooth bestirre themselues rather vphold liberty dignity clerk chastice cut vice thinke doe god church good seruice protecting publike discipline hainous offender duty place ought correct according canon censure whereby impunity hauing liberty doe list haue neither feare god whose iudgement thinke farre neither men authority sith one side prelate neglect reforme side thus exempt order temporall iurisdiction 13 state church realme wherein iniured without remedy others iniurious without coertion neither sort condition subiects king man excellent wisedome constancy zeale tooke especiall care quickning idem nubrig l 2 cap 1 publike discipline rigour ancient lawes thus lay neglected end hee setled choise minister iustice part land▪ vpon complaint brought subiects remissenes defect iudges hee accordingly princely prouidence applied remedy chastised delinquent like remissenes censure harder complained spirituall houeden fox iudges occasioned murther committed priest sarum diocesse archbishoppe commanded depriued put abbey whereby freed sharper punishment intended king iusticiaries like affront archbishop king fox p 264 conceiued little displeasure requiring iustice ministred alike without partiality nubrig l 2 c 16 sine delectu seeing apparantly tend vnto ruine roiall gouernment archbishop side stood lesse peremptory immunity clergy see yea farre hee challenged geruasius ad 1163 c •… gestiret iura cant ecclesiae reuocare crown king great offence custody rochester castle fort king ireland reduce stray enlighten ignorance polish rudenesse let abundant matter merite immortall glory escape god himselfe prosper enterprise holy church hath long since approued vpon author miscarry though thy noble christian courage nothing weigh much see work mightily yet satisfie irish phrase vse thou thee respect thou shalt haue far larger territory thou canst possesse goodly land distribute reward among thy friend follower last offer shall shew desire vse thy force loue thy person vertues trifle propose god himselfe doth seeme haue laid ground seeing holy thou time shouldst bee without wife know thou haue one daughter eua heire crowne comfort age let thine owne eye tell thee faire worthy dare auouch thou wilt thinke far broader sea wel crost view honest beauty first blossome youth earle brother euery earle hauing searched learned cause king sudden displeasure whose loue hee redeemed many loiall seruices hee sends two men arm french court behalf sort soeuer defend honour innocency houed ibid accuser man found court neither king would vndertake proofe maintenance thereof wherupon euer afterward richard held brother deare gaue lesse credite king philip word 68 ensued fatall accident drew blacke cloud death ouer triumphall bright shining starre cheualrie vnworthy occasion misaduenture make lamentable notwithstanding document great one outrage auarice cruelty god therein onelie liues limb might saued hee would accept condition bidding defend themselues could would enter sword hang grieues thinke prince forget himselfe behold seuerity god iudgement arbalaster archibalista standing vpon wall seeing time charged steele bow square arrow quarrell ger dorob making first praier god hee would direct shot deliuer innocency besieged oppression whereupon discharging king taking view castle roger houed mat par ypod neust within danger distance engin king ger dorob vpon hearing bow goe stooping head mortally wounded left shoulder anguish perill wherof extremely proud legate would condiscend vnlesse bishop would yeeld goe foot student paules church legate house mile vngowned vnshod humbly craue absolution accordingly performed 60 legate long called home pope mat paris vpon notice scandall daylie ann 1239 giuen england vnsatiable auarice romanes earnest working king feared lest great one would rise hee detained necessary euill establish good peace manner king england neither could make answere thing without king head vpon lay heare denunciation protested answere ought giue regard oath death alexander king made one keepe vnder paine excommunication whereupon king deliuered letter patent acknowledged comming scot side water twede time vrged preiudice comming againe england example drawne argument king edward right ouer come againe vpon dutie present full consent 1295 whole realme regaine honestlie sword craftilie gotten away cunning trick ypod neustr renouncing french homage aquitain wale also time full trouble fire rebellion rashly kindled long quencht blood actor thousand complices 25 baliol hauing thus obtained crowne 1296 scotland finding party homage made king edward much empaired among scot greatly repined thereat regaining loues tho uuals attempted secret combination french english edward ignorant hect boe li 14 requiring vertue homage aid power king france tho vvals discouered baliols delay trauerses said conspiracie whereupon aduanced forward scot puissant armie newcastle vpon tyne first blood drawne english scot tho wals polyd verg lib 17 saith one hundreth slew almost one thousand village vnder leading one robert de ro fled king edward city carlile likewise assaulted county cumberland spoiled seuen earles scotland company edward greatly displeasing said first hostile act done full purpose subdue last might bee sole albion god reserued time might wonder effected 26 king edward therefore presented himselfe 1297 strong towne berwick mighty host auspicate entrance conquest scotland summons sent towne abode one whole day without offer violence townesmen refusing render victory english marriners rashly entring twentie foure ship harbour repelled losse foure vessel soone reuenged forceuble taking berwick tho uualsingh berwick taken king edward hector boetius saith exercised great lib 14 cruelty english towne flemish merchant smothered english fire strong house maner tower whence leueld entring english dart iauelins one casually slew richard cornewal gallant gentleman brother earle cornwal army heated former contumely scot vpon slaughter repulse made english marriners published certaine rime derision fabian vvhat wenys king edward longshancks haue wonne berwicke vnthancks c together remembrance many fresh shrewd turnes might stirre vp bloody effect towne thus taken castle stood long distichon ni falat fatum scoti quocunque locatum inuenient lapidem regnare tenentur ibidem fate goe right ere stone pight regall race scot shall rule place whomsoeuer written liue finde happily made hast england presence extremely wanting way home towne called tho wals ardeburg scot almost hee brought serue flemish warres forsooke went paris 34 arriuall england hee summoned parliament yorke giuing scot day appeare thereat acknowledging ought doe hee entred mightie army country nauy laden victual coasting along contrary wind holden time put scot rather hope victory reason scarsity prouisions among english three dayes scot appeared shippes came plentifully refresht fainting souldiers hereupon king led forward people vpon next morning terrible showt heard scottish host english ranne armes king horse affrighted sodaine tumultuous noise hee putting foote stirrup threw earth striking hinder heeles brake two rib neuerthelesse vpon horse proceeded person battell vvillam vvallace wonne himselfe many hardy enterprise singular opinion among peeres people hauing set scot array whose number far exceeded english vsed euery short speech vnto stead oration haue brought king hop gifyee kun security hee tho walsingh bloudy ourethrow pawkirke fixed betweene english certaine pale stake bound together rope english vauntguard brake downe came stroke first fled scottish horseman leauing infanterie battels foote open great destruction followed victory resting clearely english 35 scottish hect boet l 14 author writes reason emulation vvallace scot burning mutuall hatred made enterprise easie enemy may bee verie true certainely scarse anie battell betweene two nation scottish bloud spilt thereof vniuers cosin lib 2 sebastian munster seemes meane saying slaine threescore french king sister canterbury made whole affaire finish annexation scotland crowne england 38 therefore accompanied sonne dreadfull army pursued matter close whereas scot gotten together againe exceeding great number vnder seuerall captaines whose hect boe lib 14 enuie caused wallace giue vp authority commonwealth scotland formerly granted vnto preseruation freedomes flying king edward whose fortune warre worthily made terrible day walsinghams iudgement beene irrecouerably fatall scottish name english beene able haue followed armour ouer bogges mountaines welsh naturall nimblenesse supplied sure edward held himselfe fast possession hee neither would grant scottish lord baliol raigne ouer requested saith walsingham suffer redeeme land hee giuen english among 39 armes failing scot hauing made way court rome procured inhibitory pope interposeth authority reliefe scotland letter pope brought one lumbardus scotland king swearing per sanguinem dei terrible oath said would desist neuerthelesse scot dayes requested king let liue peace till taken counsell peeres king france threatning otherwise pope would take matter vpon king disdainefull smile answered haue done homage mee chiefe lord kingdome scotland suppose terrified swelling lie like one power compell would let right haue ouer slip hand let heare swear lord consume scotland sea sea side scot boldly enough replie alfons vnder monument named picture ouer edvvard second lord monarch 48 edward ii ireland dvke aqvitaine c fortieeighth monarch england raigne act issve chapter xi mind deriued parent certainely second edward called caeernaruon might nothing else abundantlie shew valiant wise fortunate father vnlike sonne yet beginne description course preiudice person temper stile owne action sincerely related rather verball censure man may bee iudged cannot denied whereas conquest till time england though endured god iust iudgements many bitter sad heauy stormes headinesse ambition sickness mind prince thereof yet men sway gouerne distemper perturbation incident vigorous disposition whereas vnder edward could neither get keepe seemed endure leuities child though yeeres twenty three might haue exempted great infancie iudgement raigne discouered 2 neuer came prince crowne generall applause great hope well victorious father edward thom de la moor vvinchester left vpon besides right succession whose last warning terrible adiurations haue heard tho vvalsing vtter contempt breach whereof destruction himselfe friend hee manner auspicated gouernement 3 edward best maner prouided pol virg lib 18 affaire scotland domfrees many scottish hect boe lib 14 bellind tran lib 14 cap 9 lord homage father first taske hee gaue future behauiours home rigorous reuenge taken vpon walter de langton bishoppe comely shape briefly one wee vse call fine neither yet vnhardie arm commendable performance whereof saith de la moore hee gaue proofe scot •… ind transl lib 14 cap 9 hee alike hatefull english till hee recalled satisfie saith courtier enuie grace good successe christian morall vertues onely make men truly commendable great silence author though vice wherof wee shall haue occasion enough speake hereafter 6 coronation king queen lord would haue empeached hee promised reasonably act mon p 459 satisfie gaueston none tho de la neere peirs brauery apparrell delicacie fashion king gaue tho vvals customes authority also place preuailed much king parliament holden london sundry prouisions concerning liberty people execution iustice enacted corporall oath confirmed king himselfe among decree gauestons perpetuall banishment king ouercome meere necessity satisfaction kingdome said earle cornwall odious vnwillinglie suffered passe king thereupon regratified subsidie twentieth part subiects good king also tooke oath reuoke said earle cornwall frō banishment may called banishment wherin th de la kingdom ireland entrusted charge securing thereof rebel furnished men money king 9 yet forgetting affection earle cornwal reuoked oftentimes deserue praise priuate person subiect much construction publike neglecting deceased father solemne adiurations also owne oath carelesse sequele fabian l bartholmew de ashburnham neuer english earth one time drinke much bloud noble vile manner shed whatsoeuer could bee pretended doubtlesse offence capitall yet taken done quarrell spenser onely vnreuenged appeare mean space enemy contented bloud procured also fabian holinsh p 332 c 1 confiscation estate inheritance 44 king edward thinking exploit made terrible aswell scot done english marcheth mighty hoast scotland whence long want victual king edward endangered scot hee compelled returne without honor atchieuement tho de la tho wels vpon returne sodainely scot assailed night narrowly escaping owne person saued flight leauing tpod neust treasure furniture pillage came sorrowfull yorke iohn de britain earle richmond taken prisoner enemy rest country defaced destruction farre wals city 45 thus tho de la passed yeere english full losse reproach lamentation reason intestine discord shamble noble king infamous hatefull also vnfortunate iourney northern part c bloudy tempestuous wind blew profit fabian space fiue yeeres fortune spencer hugely encreased queenes decreased relenting toward lord expressing dislike rancklygrowing weed grown beare share persecution like violent men working vpon king inclination onely author sharpe reuenge taken vpon lord particular inglorious enrichment else call since betraide thereby soueraignes crown life speedie destruction let part appeare moue world rather pitty seduced 46 among condemned rising earle lancaster one 1323 ki •… g edward bitte •… ly vpbraids earle lancaster death meane familie whose life neuerthelesse hee serued court pleasing grand potent fauourites therein many interceded pressed king farre behalfe brake walsingham c •… verba imperij vehement word plague vpon cursed whisperer malicious backebiters wicked counsellor entreat life notorious knaue would speake one word life neere kinsman noble knight earle thomas hee liued wee whole realme haue speciall need vse fellow longer hee liues villanies wil commit hauing already filled kingdome desperate outrage soule god hee shall therefore die death hath deserued 47 euident tragedy lord exploited others plaine king otherwise deuout god noble full naturall good propensions fatally ouerwrought wicked counsell though hee therein bee inexcusable good nature wee call cannot satisfie publike errours condemned man forth put death accordingly king highlie offended none entreated earles behalfe saith walsingham wardlie loue neuerthelesse long created elder spenser earle winchester deckt plume fortune toppefeather taken said late earle lancaster estate say castle honour tho vvalsin donington parcell earledome lincolne hauing thus farre shewed originall mischiefe wee hasten last act catastrophe edward tragedie onely wee first remember intercurring matter 48 haue heard cardinal sent pope fauour english put scotland vnder interdict wherefore king robert last dispatched bishop glascow thomas randolfe earle murrey rome obtaining release absolution returned without effecting whereupon king robert moued haue truce thirteene yeeres king edward accordingly granted pope pol vir •… lib 1 •… absolued scot matter scotland seemed thus sufficiently prouided time rather somewhat motion truce king caused newly created earle carlile andrew de herkley degraded hanged drawne quartered treason hee conuinced haue entred scot vpon tho wals done speciall seruices hauing cause castle citie carleil committed gouernment truce scotland thus confirmed king make progresse ypod neust county yorke lancaster march wale whence late seditious daughter sole heire king france married gripple miser promised queene shee become better waiting woman liuing vpon pension spenser 51 thus matter embrion common destruction laid begun impotencie woman diuision cap 13 boetius small iniuries people thereof desired nought banner bee erected wals euer pleasant enemy great humanity people place scotland lodged finally hee shewed lord scotland hee came peece common lay betweene ruthen glendowr owen despite lord gray richard continued king formerly holden though without contention owen man high courage impatient force armes hereupon encounter lord gray field scattered said lord people tooke prisoner hereafter elsewhere bee touched 22 seemes herein hee forgotten lawes formerly studied wherin hee licentiate shortly hee troden law vnder foot also brother thomas duke clarence better respect borne forth youth prince henry done whose distemper like breed great trouble time stayed brother quoth henry true subiects honour brother otherwise shall assoone execute iustice vpon meanest birth kingdome king reioycing vnexpected answere prudently christianly charged god minister law indifferently ease oppressed beware flatterer deferre iustice yet sparing mercy punish quoth hee oppressor thy people shalt thou obtaine fauour god loue feare thy subiects while haue wealth long shalt thou haue obedience made poore oppression ready make insurrection passage one without impediment encamped themselues best aduantage vpon enemie neuerthelesse made diuers sally losse either party king henry inforced siege vtmost made myne vnderneath wals perceiued defendant countermined king forward enguerrant king henry fighteth single combat first man entring myne barbason likewise within towne met point sword performed nobly part priuate souldiers nobly indeed priuate souldiers prince remember till lastly agreed discouer themselues first barbason made known name translator liuie king henry whereupon french lord suddainely getting backe caused barrier closed henry returned campe 58 enterprize failing king charles himselfe enguerrant came campe induce defendant render presence naturall lord neuerthelesse little respected answere made king liberty free king henry power would doe french refuse submit owne king duty naturall subiects yeeld charge liege lord desired excused mortall enemy france would yeeld 59 whilest king henry lay siege melun intention rob fab greatly dismayed hee set himselfe king seate vnexpected challenge duke though first hee greatly meant haue deposed king henry speed bee crowned himselfe alhallontide next yet finding amasement silence hee sends pedigree claime writing might better consider yeelding seemes ordered therein according generall agreement treaty whereof would visite king henrie alleadging himselfe peerelesse england maine point title followeth king edward third issue edward prince vvales vvilliam main point •… duke york pedegree hatfield lionell duke clarence iohn gaunt lancaster edmund yorke thomas glocester vvilliam vvindsor edward prince wale dyed liuing father left issue richard second king england died without issue also william king edward second sonne 85 lionel third sonne issue philip daughter heire married edmund •… ortimer earle march issue roger earle march issue edmund earle march roger anne eleanor edmund roger eleanor died without issue anne heire house marrieth richard earle cambridge sonne edmund duke yorke fifth sonne king edward third earle cambridge richard commonly saith booke called duke yorke 86 iohn gaunt fourth son younger brother lionel issue henry immediately king richards resignation vnrighteously saith booke entred vpon edmund earle march sonne roger earle march philip daughter heire said lionel duke clarence elder brother iohn duke lancaster aliue aswell said henry eldest son iohn duke lancaster descendent haue hitherto holden crowne england c vniustly himselfe said richard plantagenet duke yorke lawfull heire sonne richard plantagenet earle cambridge anne said 87 effect duke york title point pedegree true though barre thereof friend king henry without denying part premise euident could honestly denied little say allegation k henry 6 lancastrian title could among thing alleadge richard second resigned vp crowne regality large none else making claime henry duke lancaster hee thereunto consent three estate admitted richard earle castell sandall standeth pleasantly vpon small hill view faire town vvakefield duke yorke comming thither vpon christmas eue reposeth himselfe expecteth encrease number queene aduertised thinkes wisdome fight duke grow strong thereupon marcheth forward hauing army eighteene thousand men led duke sommerset excester earles stows annal deuonshire graft chron wiltshire lord neuill clifford rosse effect northerne nobility host much therof thought necessary shew present selfe sandall prouoke dare duke queenes army come wakefield battell bloud impatient braues ignorant perhaps enemy great multitude needes fight though earle salisbury sir dauid hall ancient seruant great souldier gaue aduise stay till sonne earle march approched welshman marcher hee great number assembled god would forbeare longer like seuere master meanes take present account found whether kingdomes earth worth least sinne much lesse wilfull periurie 89 queene therefore addeth stratageme wit force entent hee might escape hand whereupon earle wiltshire vpon one side hill lord clifford vpon lie ambush thrust castell duke sommerset exceter stand embattelled open field policy wished successe duke fully fiue thousand strong issueth castle downe hill battels stood front ioyne furiously sodainly duke yorke see himselfe inclosed although hee expressed great manhood yet within one halfe houre whole armie discomfited himselfe diuers ouerthrow duke yorke kill deare friend beaten downe slaine lay dead lord harington sir thomas neuill sonne earle salisburie sir dauid hal sundry knight others two thousand himselfe bee mother rule partly earnest partly pleasance made reply marriage spirituall type ought rather conioyned god framed party consent regard temporall respect whatsoeuer choice pleasing himselfe would subiects certainly knew whose amity nation hee preferred desired neither could giue better occasion loue soueraigne hee disdained marry tribe likewise issue could prince better beloued naturall prince borne parent forraine alliance needfull hee many kin contract content party himselfe marry possession please others displeasing affection hee saw wisdome hauing already sufficient one toward k edward draweth towards london warwicke vnto towne likewise brother clarence foure thousand strong march meeting vpon plaine three mile towne set battels aray meant haue fought king brother gloucester lord riuers hastings others without gard made towards clarence beheld himselfe accompanied estate encountred brother louing countenance friendly cheare sparke hatred perceiued betwixt selfe false periured duke ere oath shall bee falsified apparantly lay downe life enemy foote doubt shall bee bought deere 61 stout resolution made edward warie therefore obtaine london key k edward lord loued thing studied vpon coronation honor king lord kindred assemble king name much people giue lord contrary faction cause feare suspect least gather people king safegard man impugned destruction hauing regard old variance new attonement cause assemble party much people againe defence whose power shee wist well stretched farre thus realme fall vproare hurt thereof insue likely little harme like fall shee least would world would put kindred blame say vnwisely vntrulie also broken amity peace king husband prudently made betwixt kin death bed party faithfully obserued 15 queene wise perswaded sent word vnto sonne vnto brother queene yeldeth duke perswasion king besides duke glocester selfe lord chiefe bend wrote vnto king reuerently queenes friend louingly nothing earthly mistrusting brought vp king great hast good speed sober company king way london gone northampton duke glocester buckingham lord meet northampton came thither remained behind lord riuers king vncle intending morrow follow king bee stonystratford twelue mile thence earely ere departed made night much friendlie cheare betwixt two duke lord riuers great incontinent openly great curtesie departed lord riuers lodged duke secretly priuy friend set councell wherein spent great part night rising dawning day sent priuily seruants innes lodging giuing command make themselues shortly ready lord horseward vpon message many folke attendant many l riuers seruants vnready keyes inne kept richard duke glaucester 16 duke taken custody keyes inne none passe forth without licence besides highway towards stonystratford king lay bestowed certaine men send backe againe compell returne man gotten northampton towards stonystratford till order forasmuch duke themselues intended shew diligence bee first day attend vpon king highnesse towne thus bare folke hand lord riuers vnderstood gate closed l riuers much troubled sodaine action wayes beset neither seruants suffered goe considering well great thing without knowledge could bee done nought comparing present manner last night cheare howres haue great change marueilously misliked beit sith hee could get away keepe himselfe close hee would lest hee seeme hide himselfe secret feare fault wherof saw cause himselfe hee determined vpon surety owne conscience goe boldly vnto enquire matter might meane soone saw beganne quarrell saying hee entended set distance betweene king bring confusion lie power beganne hee l riuers imprisoned northampton well spoken man seemely wise excuse himselfe carried end answere shortly took put ward done forthwith went horsebacke tooke way stonystratford found king company ready leape horsebacke depart forward leaue lodging strait company 17 soone came presence alighted downe company duke buckingham said go duke come king afore gentleman yeoman keepe room goodly array came king knee humble manner saluted grace receiued ioyous amiable manner nothing knowing mistrusting yet done euen presence picked quarrell lord gray king quarrell picked king presence brother mother saying lord marquesse brother lord riuers vncle compassed rule king realm set variance among state subdue destroy noble bloud realme towards accomplishing whereof said lord marquesse entred tower london accusation queen kindred thence taken king treasure sent men sea thing duke well knew done necessary good purpose whole councell london sauing somwhat must say 18 vnto word king answered king excuseth vncle brother marquesse done cannot say good sooth dare well answere mine vncle riuers brother inocent matter yea liege quoth duke buckingham haue kept dealing matter farre knowledge good grace forth arrested lord richard sir thomas vaughan sir richard hawt knight king presence well enough arme ouer since withered •… ne protector nature 〈◊〉 birth neuerthelesse lord chamberlaine death king edward kept shore wife hee somewhat doated king life sauing •… said hee forbare reuerence towards king else certain kind fidelity friend answered said certainely lord haue heinously done bee worthy hainous punishment quoth protector thou seruest mee ween ifs ands tell thee haue done make good thy bodie traitor therewith great anger hee clapped fist vpon board great rap token giuen one without chamber cryed treason wherewith dore clapped came rushing men harnesse many chamber might hold anone protector said lord hastings arrest thee traitor mee lord quoth hee yea thee traitor quoth protector another l chamberlain arrested let flie lord stanley shrunke stroke vnder table else head beene cleft teeth swiftly hee shrunke yet came bloud eares quickly bestowed diuers chamber excepting l staley wounded councell table onely lord chamberlaine protector bad speede shriue apace paul said hee dinner till see thy head booted aske heauily tooke priest aduenture made short shrift longer would suffered protector made much haste dinner hee might goe till done sauing oath hee brought forth vnto greene chappell within tower head laid vpon long logge timber strucke afterward body head enterred windsor beside body k edward l chamberlaine beheaded 45 maruailous case heare either warning hee haue voided token hee could auoid self night death lord stanley sent trusty secret messenger vnto midnight hast requiring rise ride away vtterly disposed longer abide hee l stanley dreame fearefull dreame thought bore tuskes razed heades bloud ranne shoulder forasmuch protector gaue bore cognizance dreame made fearefull impression heart hee throughly determined longer tarry horse ready lord hastings would goe ride yet farre night would danger day ah good lord quoth lord hastings messenger leaneth lord thy master much trifle hath faith dreames either owne feare fantasieth doe rise night rest reason dayes thought tell plaine witchcraft beleeue dreames l hastings answere l stanleye •… age token thing come thinketh hee wee might likely make true going caught brought back friend faile flyer bore cause likely rase v tuskes men fled falshood wherefore either peril none indeed rather going abiding wee must need fall perill one way yet rather men see men falshood thinke fault faintheart therefore goe thy master man commend pray bee merry haue feare assure sure man wotteth mine owne hand god send grace sir said messenger went way 46 certaine also riding towards 64 much talked maruelled manner dealing matter made strange vnto party though neuer communed either others diuers opinion people themselues wist man dull heard perceiued well inough matter made betweene beit excused againe said must done good order men must sometimes manner sake acknown know consecration bishop euery man wotteth well paying bulles purposeth one though pay nothing else yet much feare anguish sorrow within haue heard credible report secret guilty conscience king richard chamberlaine abhominable deed done neuer quiet minde neuer thought himselfe sure went abroad eies euerwhirled body priuily fenced hand euer dagger countenance manner like one alwaies readie strike againe tooke il rest night lay long waking musing sore wearied care watch rather slumbred slept towards duke glocester death king edward came yorke sent thither secret wise trusty seruant named persall assure would take part new world need would waite vpon thousand goodfellowes againe sent offer like vnto nottingham whither protector yorke many gentleman north countrey come way londonward secret manner met himselfe northampton openly three hundred horse thence still continued partner deuises till coronation departed seemed great friend glocester frō duke buckingham fals dislike king richard whence soone duke came home lightly turned highly conspired man would maruell whereof change grew surely occasion variance diuers men diuersely reported haue said duke little coronation among thing required protector duke hertfords land pretended himselfe iust inheritor forasmuch title occasion king duke falling asunder claimed inheritance somewhat interlaced title crowne line king henry depriued protector conceiued indignation reiected duke request many spightfull minatory wordes wounded heart hatred mistrust neuer could indure looke aright king richard euer feared owne life farre forth protector rode london towards coronation fained himselfe buckingham fained himselfe sick attend k henry sicke would ride taking euill part sent word rise come ride would make carried whereupon hee rode euill notwithstanding morrow rose feast faining himselfe sick whereat king richard said done hatred despite say euer continually liued hatred distrust duke verily looked haue beene murdered gloucester neuerthelesse faire manner departed surely right secret day denie feares duke buckingham many right wise men thinke vnlikely deepe dissembling nature men considered need greene world protector duke perill duke stood fell suspition tyrant either protector would giue duke occasion displeasure duke protector suspition betwixt king duke said occasion mistrust verily men thinke king richard conceiued opinion would neuer haue suffered duke haue escaped hand 22 truth buckingham high held best make ouer england interpose proceeding ere match fully made whereupon earle richmund two thousand men onely small number ship set sayle harflent fifteenth august seuenth day following henry richmund ariueth milford hauen arriued milford hauen wale taking land hee came vnto dale thence next day marched hereford west ten mile maine thence marched cardigan newes countrey forelaid finding vntrue made still forward beating downe houlds held sending secretly lady margaret mother henry sent word ariuage mother others lord stanley talbot others signified vnto meant passe seuerne weapon terrible iuno hath prepared notwithstanding marriage shee faining herselfe ioyfull hath faithfully promised beare toward v fauour good shee changeable winde peruerting thing aswell diuine humane feares god fury seekes vtter ruine owne blood thou ô god knowest deliuer v also seeme worthy euils sinnes haue deserued suffer doe thou ô lord thy good pleasure neuerthelesse wee owe thy grace secretly conueied ouer sea polyd verg l 26 whither hee brought party conueiance charge suddenly forsooke thereby forced wander m perkini proclamati diuerse country remained certain yeeres vnknown polydor lib 26 til length came true vnderstanding himselfe m per procl seasonit hapned one henry son edmund tydder earle richmund come france enter realme subtill fowle meanes obtaine crowne said richard rightfullie appertained henry extreame mortall enemie soone knowledge aliue imagined wrought subtill way meanes could deuise finall destruction said mortall enemie hath falsely surmised fained borne entred gate bolloigne wonne duke suffolke presented keyes towne trumpet still sounding nothing wanting might applaud fame towne thus wonne english meant still keep strengthening whereof king commanded faire church saint mary taken downe place mount raised planting ordinance annoy siege thus busied bolloignes affaire emperour without knowledge consent came peace french king whereat king henrie sore displeased sooner left france leauing r gra •… con sir iohn dudley lord lisle deputy bolloigne landed douer first day october great honor ioy subiects 129 french king chafed late great losse sought trie fortune attempt iohn serres onely recouery bolloigne twenty thousand well appointed hee assaied also assayling english dominion ile wight part sussex french inuade ile wight coast sussex lay vpon sea though losse many captaines thousand souldiers neuer returned tell intertainement likewise sending aide vnto scotland monsieur mungumry order france 5000 strong entred maintaine breach betwixt roade made scotland k henry followed part english making roade towards gedworth got praise valour reproch spoiles scot renowne killing lord eure lord warden eastmarches many captaines defence countrey lord 〈◊〉 slaine 130 hereupon army twelue thousand strong sent scotland whereof earle hertford generall forraged border burnt many townes middlemarches kelsey coldingham abbey french hastie stay incursion lay still let vnfought depart england 131 warres remoued againe france reingr •… e great power came victuall 1546 fort built neere vnto bolloigne impeach earle surrey lie •… enemy prepared themselues fight strong guard maintained bridge besides passage ouer riuer held course betwixt two army 25 great attempt lord lieutenant gaue manfull resistance valiant attempt lord russell rebell made yet lastly way wonne followed vnto battell disloyals presently beganne cruell fight maintained losse blood false heart failing true subiects courage increasing cornish immediately gaue backe fled whereat king souldiers order fell spoile minding nothing lesse presently rebel put flight ensued cornishman perceiuing disordered carriage suddainely returned began new fight lord captaine three hundred shott 26 lord russels force augmented greatest care releeue city excester whither vpon third august hasted honiton thousand strong passing ouer downes toward woodbury lodged lord preseruation noble king vnto whose maiesty wish c •… uall health felicitie abundance prosperous successe moreouer wish counsellers grace fauour god whereby may rule thing vprightly iustice vnto exhort lord shew selues obedient also necessarie vnder paine condemnation also profitable preseruation king maiesty thereupon asking euery man forgiuenesse freely forgaue euery man desiring people bee quiet lest flesh troubled though spirit willing hee meekely laide downe head axe receiued one stroke rest death 73 howsoeuer duke cause ballanced law taken away stood betwixt duke sōmerset soone mist sore lamented sunne yet death heauily disgested people spake bitterly duke northumberland especially young king sore mourned soone missed life protector thus vnexpectedly taken away depriued vncles wise would admitte bee vncouered 82 entring conference first gaue heartie thankes sermon repeating vnto chiefe point thereof coming exhortation conference betwixt king bishoppe ridlay poore told
